channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Clippers, Steve Ballmer reportedly sent money to Aspiration multiple times before Kawhi Leonard payments
Wall Street Journal Tells Donald Trump He Now Totally Owns The Biggest Voter Worry Of All
Guest dies, became unresponsive after riding new Universal Epic Universe theme park roller coaster
Barack Obama Reacts To Jimmy Kimmel Suspension, Says Media Companies Need To “Start Standing Up” To Trump Team’s “Dangerous” Cancel Culture
EU defence chief to convene talks on 'drone wall' to protect against Russia
Shooting kills 3 officers and wounds 2 more in rural Pennsylvania. Police say the shooter is dead
item.description: Authorities have been investigating a shooting that killed three officers and wounded two more in rural southern Pennsylvania.

item.title: US jobless aid applications retreat to 231,000 after surging to nearly 4-year high
item.description: The number of Americans applying for jobless aid last week retreated significantly after surging to a nearly four-year high a week earlier

item.title: Judge blocks deportation of Guatemalan kids, saying justification "crumbled"

item.title: RFK Jr. announces move to decertify organ procurement organization
item.description: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced a move to decertify an organ procurement organization and steps to reform the organ donation system.

item.title: Spirit Airlines to cut capacity by 25% this fall, hints at layoffs
item.description: Capacity cuts "will inevitably affect the size of our teams," Spirit Airlines CEO Dave Davis said in a memo to employees.

item.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing feared being shot by police before surrendering, sheriff says
